subject: Re: [junit] Re: Where to write  the  test
msgSnippet: JUnit cookbook is rated very highly. ... __________________________________ Do you Yahoo!? Meet the all-new My Yahoo! - Try it today! http://my.yahoo.com
messageBody:
JUnit cookbook is rated very highly.

--- Andreas Guther <andreas@...> wrote:

>
>
> If you mean where to put the junit tests:
>
> we put our java code under src/java and our unit
> tests under src/test
> but always in the same package.
>
> There are quite a few excellent books on Junit on
> the bookstore shelfs
> and it will help tremendously reading at least one
> of them.
>
> Andreas
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "gadesudhirreddy"
> <gadesudhirreddy@y...>
> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hello friends,
> >
> > Iam new to unit testing,
> > where to write the unit testing code.
> > please help me
> > Regards
> > sudhir
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
